gurmukhi: suin dY sRaun bwq qoso ]kvn ju`Du kir jIqY moso ]KVg isMG mo AMqr nwhI ]muih srUp vrqq jg mwhI ]1736]
transliteration: Soun(i) Dai Sraoun Baat Kaho Toso|| Kavan Juddh(u) Kar(i) Jeetai Moso|| Khadag Singh Mo Antarr Naahee|| Muh(i) Saroop Vartat Jag Maahee||1736||
translation: “Listen attentively to my words and understand who has been victorious over me in the war? There is no difference between me and Kharag Singh and my form only pervades the whole wold.1736.

gurmukhi: swc khXo hY hy bldyvw ]pwXo nihn iksU ieh Byvw ]sUrn mY koaU ieh sm nwhI ]myro nwm bsY ird mwhI ]1737]
transliteration: Saach Kahyo Hai He Baldevaa|| Paayo Nahin Kisoo Eh Bhevaa|| Sooran Mai Ko( i)  Eh Sm Naahee|| Mero Naam Basai Rid Maahee||1737||
translation: “O Balram! I am telling you the truth; none knows about this mystery; there is no warrior amongst the warriors like him, in whose heart abides my Name with such profundity.1737.

gurmukhi: audr mwJ bis mws ds qij Bojn jl pwn ]pvn AhwrI huie rihE bru dIno Bgvwn ]1738]
transliteration: Udar Maajh Bas(i) Maas Das Taj(i) Bhojan Jal Paan|| Pavanahaarihue Rahio Bar(u) Deeno Bhagvaan||1738||
translation: “Residing in the womb of the mother for ten months, when he passed his life by relinquishing, eating and drinking and subsisting only on air, then the Lord bestowed on him a boon.1738.

gurmukhi: irp jIqn ko bru lIXo KVg isMG blvwn ]bhuir qpsXw bn krI duAwds brK pRmwn ]1739]
transliteration: Rip Jeetan Ko Bar(u) Leeo Khadag Singh Balvaan|| Bahur(i) Tapasyaa Ban Kariduaadas Brakh Pramaan||1739||
translation: “The powerful Kharag Singh asked for the boon of conquering the enemy and then for twelve years, he performed most stern aausterities.”1739.

gurmukhi: bIqI kQw BXo qb Bor ]jwgy suBt duhU ids Er ]jrwisMD dlu sij rn AwXo ]jwdv dlu bl lY smuhwXo ]1740]
transliteration: Beetikathaa Bhayo Tab Bhor|| Jaage Soubhat Duhoo Dis Or|| Jaraasindh Dal(u) Saj(i) Ran Aayo|| Jaadav Dal(u) Bal Lai Samuhaayo||1740||
translation: This episode ended and the day dawned; the warriors of both the sides awoke; bedecking his army, Jarasandh came into the battlefield and from this side, the Yadava army, gathering all its warriors set itself against the enemy.1740.

gurmukhi: sRI bldyv sBY dlu lY ieq qy aumifE auq qy auie Awey ]ju`Du kIXo hl lY inj pwn hkwr hkwr pHwr lgwey ]
transliteration: Sribaldev Sabhai Dal(u) Lai It Te Oumdio Out Te Ue Aae|| Juddh(u) Keeyo Hal Lai Nij Paan Hakaar Hakaar Prahaar Lagade||
translation: Balram from this side and the enemy from the other side alonghwith their armies rushed forward; Balram took his plough in his hand and challenging the enemy struck his blows;

gurmukhi: eyk pry Bt jUJ Drw pr eyk lrY iml kY iek Dwey ]mUsl lY bhuro kr mY Air mwr Gny jm Dwm pTwey ]1741]
transliteration: Ek Dare Bhat Joojh Dharaa Par Ek Darai Mil Kai Ik Dhaae|| Moondal Lai Bahuro Kar Mai Ar(i) Maar Ghane Jam Dhaan Pathaae||1741||
translation: Someone died and fell upon the earth, someone fought and someone fled away; then Balram took his mace in his hand despatched many enemies to the abode of Yama.1741.

gurmukhi: ros BXo Gin sXwm lXo Dnu bwn sMBwr qhI auT DwXo ]Awn prXo qb hI iqn pY irp kau hiq kY nd sRon bhwXo ]
transliteration: Ros Bhayo Ghan(i) Syaam Layo Dhan(u) Dhan(u) Baan Sanbhaar Tahiouth Dhaayo|| Oon Daryo Tab Hitin Pai Rip Hkau Hat(i) Kai Nad Sron Bahaayo||
translation: Krishna took his bow and arrows in his hands and marched towards the same side and falling upon the enemy, he caused a stream of blood to flow;

gurmukhi: bwj krI rQ piq ibpiq prI rn mY nih ko TihrwXo ]Bwjq jwq sBY iris Kwq kCU n bswq khY duKu pwXo ]1742]
transliteration: Baaj Karirath Pat(i) Bipat(i) Pariran Mai Nah(i) Ko Thah(i)raayo|| Bhaajat Jaat Sabhai Ris(i) Khaat Khaat Kachhodh Na Basaat Kahai Doukh(u) Paayo||1742||
translation: A great affliction fell upon the horses, elephants and the chariot-owners; none could stay in the war arena; all are running away, they are in anger and anguish and also helpless.1742.
